card.text: From 1904 until 1925, the building served as the power house and laundry.
In 1925, Doll's House was converted to a residence hall, called "Tower Hall".

The Doll's House also owes its identity to Dr. Park's joy in naming things. When it was converted to a dormitory, Dr. Park thought its rooms were so small that students would have to be the size of dolls to enjoy them.
Doll's house now houses the Admissions office.
